text: Probably would be possible using CMS Enterprise. That tier will give you membership areas (AKA user authentication) and your recipes could either be treated as custom objects or stored in a HubDB (depending on the use-case) and either associated to the contact record (in the case of a custom object) or managed via comma-separated text contact property containing the recipe IDs (in the case of using HubDB).
what HS development courses would you recommend? (i've already taken many courses :sweat_smile:)

Hey Mark, thanks for the reply
Basically what i need to do is, when a user logs in he is redirected to their dashboard, and on that dashboard he can see recipes that are saved by the user. The recipes are stored in hubdb.
already taken haha what's the newest?
User can change their details etc and also he will have access to some files

<@UA886MF42> Looks like this is fixed for the standard editor but im still noticing these bugs in the global editor when tyring to edit DND Global Partials — specifically global footers although I imagine it is with any global dnd partial.

Wondering if these fixes need to be rolled out for the Global Editor as well?
So to wrap up when a user is logged in, and he saves a recipe, that recipe needs to be shown on the user dashboard page
Is that possible to achieve with the CMS enterprise??
Sorry for the delay, please send me your portal ID if you are still waiting to be reverting to the old experience.

Mind sending a quick video / link to where it’s happening? The change was mostly applied to the new “improved ux” code path for toolbars and overlays in the editor. Those changes aren’t currently in the global content editor, so not sure if it’s related to the fix I pushed (though maybe there is a different bug?)

It was updated recently. Don’t recall the exact date (we likely called out when the update happened in <#C016CS822C9|academy-courses> though).

Additionally these courses may all be useful to you:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides#lessons-from-HubSpot-academy-for-developers>

Hello everyone,
Did anyone ever connect an archiving API to HubSpot and (or) know if that's possible? I know that ShareFile has a remote file uploader, using an HTML code for archiving and encryption features, but was wondering if that's possible to connect to HubSpot?
Hi <@U017J1W2X8R>, what sort of development skills/tools would you like to learn more about?
It's possible. Would definitely take custom development, but with enterprise the tools would be there to build it.
Thanks alot <@U26BLKGE4> for cleaning out this part. I will start the development tomorrow and see how it goes
